issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
ACID tables are not getting compacted properly due to an AccessControlException, this only occurs for tables contained in the non-default database.

The root cause for the issue is the re-use of an already created DistributedFileSystem instance within a new DoAs context. I will attach a patch for the same.

Stack below (anonymized)

{noformat}

fields.summary: Hive is failing to compact tables contained within a folder that is not owned by identity running HiveMetaStore

comments.body: See https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/277 for a patch, the CI build failed, looks like there is a general instability, nothing related to the PR by itself. I also looked at the existing tests, to determine if I could add one for this scenario, but could not figure out how to best incorporate a test for this scenario. I tested the patch locally, but only in the context of 2.1.1, the compaction code seems to be unchanged since then, so same issue should still occur in master and therefore be fixed with this patch. Need a reviewer and somebody to merge this, please!

[~jalberti] the change makes sense but you need to attach a patch file

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HowToContribute#HowToContribute-CreatingaPatch
reattaching the same patch - build bot was restarted and lost the original one
